common_issues.title: PiecesOS Connectivity Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties connecting to both cloud services and local LLMs within the PiecesOS application. This could be due to network configuration issues or problems with the application itself. Solutions include checking network settings, gathering log files for analysis, and scheduling calls with support for further investigation.

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## Summary of the GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* Rohanrathi99 reported an issue with their PiecesOS experiencing difficulties making requests to cloud and local models.
* Mark, a support representative, identified possible network configuration issues causing communication disruptions with Pieces.
* Rohan provided log files to further analyze the problem.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces is unable to make requests to both the cloud and local model services.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark requested Rohan's logs for analysis. 
* Mark requested to schedule a call with Rohan to investigate the problem further.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Logs have been provided by the user and reviewed by the support representative, but no particular issues were identified.
* A follow-up call was proposed to delve further into the problem.

recommendations: **Investigate Connectivity Issues:** Prioritize addressing the recurring problem of "PiecesOS Connectivity Issues." This appears to be a significant pain point for users, impacting both cloud and local LLM functionality.
**Enhance Network Diagnostics:** Develop more robust network diagnostic tools within PiecesOS to help users identify and troubleshoot connectivity problems independently.

**Improve Error Messaging:** Provide clearer and more informative error messages to users when connectivity issues arise. Instead of generic messages, offer specific guidance based on the type of connection problem detected.

**Expand Documentation and Troubleshooting Guides:** Create comprehensive documentation and troubleshooting guides specifically addressing connectivity issues, network configuration, and potential solutions.

**Review Log Analysis:** While log files were provided in the reported cases, no specific issues were identified. Review log analysis procedures to ensure they effectively pinpoint connectivity-related errors.
**Proactive Support:** Given the severity of connectivity issues, consider reaching out proactively to users experiencing similar problems to offer assistance and gather more data.

**Gather User Feedback:** Collect feedback from users who have encountered connectivity issues to understand their troubleshooting experience and identify areas for improvement in support processes or product functionality.
